content.description: A great, but short splitter. Nice hands gets you some fun but tricky finger crack with a steep finish. Stand up, place a hands piece, and walk up the slab to the anchors shared with TT.
content.location: Furthest right route at Toy Store. Right side of the leaning tower.

content.description: Start up a stem corner between the dihedral and the tower. From atop the Tower, get great high pro, then fire the steep bulge.
content.location: Left side of the leaning tower block on the Right Sector of Toy Store.

content.description: A fantastic warmup finger crack for the area, will get your blood pumping. Lots of feet on the face to keep it 5.10.Easy start to ledge on top of block allows you to place a bomber 0.2 or 0.3 nice and high to get started.
content.protection: fingers to tight hands, 0.3 to 1. A #4 will protect the move to the anchors at the summit block finish. Share anchors with Master Splinter
content.location: Right side of A frame on the splitter panel.

climbs.name: Operation
climbs.fa: A. Miller, L. Gains Germain, J. Smith

content.description: A stunning corner with a stinging finish. Start with a move from the left into a perfect hands corner. About 25' up, the crack goes to tips, than smaller. Gain an easy slab, to a bolted face, to the anchors.
content.protection: 0.1 to 2. I found a .3 Camalot X4 to protect the crux move perfectly. The 0.1 is an optional piece to protect the easy move at the top of the corner, stepping onto the slab. That piece can be laced from a comfortable stance. Not sure there is a use for the 0.2, seems a hair too small for the crux placement, but just in case.....
content.location: Jest left of Master Splinter. The obvious golden dihedral.

content.description: Another classic for the Capulin OW Circuit. A perfect Capulin splitter.
content.location: Middle of the sector of the Toy Store, the obvious beautiful splitter you can see from a mile away.

content.description: A finger and tips splitter. A hard bouldery thin tips start gains much friendlier finger and tight hand crack above. Some pocket options are available if your fingers are too fat for the crack. Still not easy. Very pretty and quite fierce.
content.protection: 0.2 to 1. extra in the fingers to tight hands, and an optional 5 for the top (easy climbing but otherwise exposed to anchors). Shared anchor with Tinker Toy.
content.location: The left side of the A-Frame splitter panel of wall on the left side of Toy Store. Obvious and pretty.

content.description: A nice moderate OW corner. The crux for me was surpassing the short dogleg.
content.protection: Fortunately, there are some inset cracks to place optional gear aside form the wide. Bring some tips pieces, and a few hands pieces. Otherwise, a single rack from 0.1 to 6. doubles in 5, (one fits perfectly in the dogleg). share anchor with Operation.
content.location: Just left of Operation, start in a hand crack that quickly goes to OW.

content.description: A super fun, and nice crack this is way too short.
content.location: Just 10' right of Tinker Toy. The pretty and short hands splitter.

pathTokens: Capulin Canyon and Cochiti Mesa Area Crags

content.description: Another nice sunny wall at Capulin perched on a ledge high on the escarpment.Lots of really nice cracks, clean, fun, and interesting. However, they are shorter than most crags. Kinda like toy versions of bigger lines
